cont.entity_a: Sound quality is excellent, with clear audio and no background noise. The headphones provide a great surround sound experience. Not suitable for bass-heavy audio, as bass response is limited. The headphones are a bit pricey, but offer good sound quality and performance.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality is generally good, but static and noise issues are common. The headphones are not suitable for music due to average sound quality. Interference with other electronic devices can cause static and sound drops.

cont.entity_a: Comfortable fit, though prolonged use can cause ear soreness due to cushion design.
cont.entity_b: The headphones are lightweight and comfortable for short periods. Poor fit, as they tend to fall off easily with movement.

cont.entity_a: Durable build, but the joints are prone to snapping if not handled gently.
cont.entity_b: Durability issues with earpieces and connections, leading to frequent breakages.

cont.entity_a: Requires line-of-sight to the transmitter for sound, as they operate via infrared. Infrared technology prevents radio interference but limits mobility.
cont.entity_b: Range is decent, allowing movement around the house without losing signal. Interference with other electronic devices can cause static and sound drops.

cont.entity_a: Easy to set up with various input options including digital coax and optical.
cont.entity_b: Easy to set up and use, with a convenient charging cradle.

cont.entity_a: Volume is strong and adjustable, with no static interference.
cont.entity_b: Volume and tuning controls are not user-friendly, causing frequent adjustments.

cont.entity_a: Rechargeable batteries included, but replacements are expensive and often out of stock.
cont.entity_b: Battery life is long-lasting and convenient with a charging cradle.

cont.entity_a: The headphones are a bit pricey, but offer good sound quality and performance.
cont.entity_b: Affordable price, but overall performance may not meet expectations.
